Reviews.Content: Stayed six nights while in town for a conference. Not right on top of the convention center, but close enough (15 min walk), and without the craziness of the shopping district. A short walk from plenty of restaurants, pike market, seattle center, etc. Was intrigued by all of the crackhead comments from other reviewers, and wanted to see if it was true. Turned out there wasn't much to see. Maybe there were a couple out there, but they seemed pretty friendly. Maybe it's not the season. Had a room facing the courtyard and it was pretty quiet. Yes, the rooms were not huge, but sufficient. Staff was friendly and helpful. Nice to have the kitchenette - whole foods market is about 10 min walk - stocked up for my stay. The only negative I could think of was lack of wireless internet access. They do have computers in a little business center which is nice, but hard to use if you really need to get some work done. I did rent a DSL modem from them which cost next to nothing and came in very handy. Overall, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: njdaveus
Reviews.Content: Clean, reasonably priced room in a new building just a few blocks from downtown are the best reasons to stay here. Great local restaurants and clubs would make this a good place to stay for a weekend away. Located by a bus stop within the free downtown bus zone is another plus. Grocery store a half-block down Third Ave makes the kitchenette and microwave a plus. Only complaint is that they only supply coffee for the in-room pots on the first night (you can buy additional packs) and housekeeping doesn't wash the coffee pot, cups, or glasses during my stay. The front desk staff are friendly, knowledgeable, and an asset.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the right guest”
Reviews.Author: sawyerpac
Reviews.Content: The Belltown Inn is a charming, recently renovated five floor building that seems to have a lot of quality for a VERY reasonable price. This hotel has many more positives than negatives, but it all depends on what you need. Close to everything downtown, the Belltown is right on the bus line (both good and bad). In the heart of a broad choice of great restaurants, safe and secure. That being said, here are a few of the positives, and a few of the negative...... Positive: Great location, secure (all halls monitored) building, laundry on site, many nearby restaurants, super staff, comfortable beds with kitchenette, plenty of hot water and good water pressure, expanded cable TV lineup, easy access to bus line in "free" zone, nice desk and work area, nice view from rooftop deck, non-smoking facility, limited pet-friendly Negative: Lot's of street noise ranging from loud talk and yelling to sirens and bus noise, small refrigerator, limited storage & closet space, only one mirror in the room (bathroom), typically expensive parking in lots and very limited street parking, VERY expensive neighborhood grocery in a less-than-desirable climate late at night Recommendations: Carry a lot of change for the panhandlers on the street (or a really good excuse to say no), try to get a courtyard room (quieter and a fountain provides white noise), earplugs might be beneficial. Parking about $250 a month for reserved parking in a secure garage (many available nearby) I would heartily recommend this location - easily the best value downtown!

Reviews.Title: “great location and cute decor”
Reviews.Author: chicknamedvick
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed for Valentine's Day weekend and the room, service, decor, and location were really great. The staff gave us a great recommendation for a breakfast cafe that had the best bacon. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in Belltown”
Reviews.Author: jcnetdev
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel dozens of times. I've had contact with every member of the staff and they are all amazingly nice people. The hotel itself is brand new. Rooms are nice, and I've never had any noise bother me. Parking may be a problem, and the corner its on isnt the greatest at night, but despite that, I'll continue to stay at Belltown Inn any time I need to do business in Seattle. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sonicpony
Reviews.Content: I think it is my duty to warn you to not go to this place. it is awful. 1. Immediate area is SKETCHY (junkies across the street smoking crack, beer drinking during the day in the empty lot next door...) 2. Hotel does not have it's own parking - so you must self-park about 1/2 a block down the road in an unsecure lot in a sketchy area... (costs $15 day) 3. Rude and awful staff (ok, well ONE of them, but she ruined my stay.. see below). I came to down for a wedding and was pleased with the price of 109. However, I should have known you get what you pay for. Room was ok and clean but nothing to write home about. Definitely fine for the money although the towels were probably the worst towels I've ever used. Parking- the staff told me I needed a parking pass for the lot for each day I was to stay. They alerted me that the passes expire at "12 noon or 2pm - can't remember"... so each day I went to buy a new pass for the lot. An inconvenience but I was paying so little overall I just went with it. Upon my check out I was approached by this older lady who came by to "get back my old parking passes". I told her I didn't save them (why would I keep my old paper parking passes?).. then she became enraged telling me that she was now going to have to charge me 250 bucks apiece for these paper passes (!!)remember, these are for paper parking passes no one ever instructed me to hold onto. Apparently, one pass is good for your entire stay but the staff clearly didn't know this and didn't communicate this to me. Regardless, she continued to threaten me as if I was "holding out" on her. I told her there would be no reason or benefit for me to keep the passes from her if I had them but did not have a time machine to retrieve them at this point. She stormed off on me after I told her I was in shock about her level of unprofessionalism and rudeness. The funny thing is that the old passes ended up being on the floor of my rental car and I gave them to another employee - but the point of the matter is that this horrifying and embarassing incident completely ruined my experience in this godawful place. It was bad until then but that incident was just the topper. I kept reminding myself that that kind of white trash is just what you can expect from such a sketchy spot. it didn't make me feel better. do yourself a favor and stay at the new Silver Cloud like my friends did. They loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: NexttripLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I needed a place to stay for one night after our Alaskan cruise. The location was ideal since it was only a few blocks away from the pier and it was affordable compared to many other hotels. The immediate blocks surrounding the property had some questionable street people like any big city, but they did not bother us at all. Although there is nothing luxurious about this place, Belltown Inn has recently been remodeled so it looks very clean. Our room had a mini refrigerator and coffee pot. I believe there is a hotpot available if you request it. There didn't seem to be a working airconditioning unit in the room. What really made an impression on me and what prompted me to write my first review was how friendly and helpful the front desk staff were. They made some wonderful suggestions on dining (all within a few blocks away), helped print our airline e-tickets, and suggested a reasonably priced towncar to take us to the airport early the next morning. My husband and I appreciated the fact that he was there by 4:30 when our pickup time was 4:45am. Overall if we ever return to Seattle for a longer visit, we'd seriously consider staying at the Belltown Inn again. We could save some money on hotel costs and use our money on other touristy activities.

Reviews.Title: “Cracktacular location, but good price for what you get (clean safe room).”
Reviews.Author: xanadugirlz
Reviews.Content: The first thing I must say is if you hate noise, book an interior room (facing a little courtyard and fountain. If you get a room facing the street be prepared to hear crackheads (and I say this, because you can literally watch them hitting their pipes in the alley accross the street) ALL NIGHT LONG. All that being said, you are downtown in a big city, and whether you are here, or somewhere higher end like the Fairmont/Hyatt, there are those types of people outside (more here, but you WILL see them anywhere), and they pretty much are not there to harrass you....they just do their little cracky thing in peace. We got this while we are moving our place isnt ready for 2 weeks....so this is a good value for in town (if you are willing to not be in town , there are many extended stay properties in Kent and beyond that offer more amenties for a lower price) In fact I think it is the best value in town. The building is secure. The staff is very nice. The room is TINY.....think Motel 6 in size (for long term living this is not) with a little kitchenette, and flat panel tv. Internet is NOT free (why?) except in the business center, and there is no specified parking, you have to park down the street in a $15 a night lot, or hope to find parking on the street (but move your car beetween 8am-6pm daily).....The room is very clean.....no a/c but rarely would you need it....there is heat (in winter youll need it) really I don;t have any complaints about the property itself besides the parking and pay internet, the location/noise thing isnt there fault, and for the price Im happy to just be somewhere safe and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the right traveller”
Reviews.Author: cross-check
Reviews.Content: Centrally located this place is perfect if you're not carborn and/or want to live downtown Seattle with close proximity to the waterfront. Best value for monthly stays. Rooms (queen bed, one person) are new and clean, furniture OK. Kitchenette has everything. Good storage room for both shoes, clothes and bags. Big and nice desk and LCD TV that's not in the way. Staff is friendly and efficient, front desk open 24 hours which feels safe. Could be better: affordable parking options, internet these days should be complimentary and wireless (they have a business centre but that's SO not attractive), mirror (one in bathroom only), noise reduction from the street (thin windows), cooling options (no airconditioning, hot in summer!) Area is a local neighbourhood, pretty tourist-free. Lots of good places for wining and dining at resonable cost. Some streets are less attractive and easily avioded. Perfect for young or solo travellers looking for long-term stays downtown.

HotelInfo.Name: Belltown Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 2301 3rd Avenue, Seattle, WA
